page.title: 18Some of the crafts
page.content: The{leather worker}produces many things ranging from keyrings to handbags and belts. He uses leather from{America,}linen thread, beeswax, harnessed needles, stamping tools and waterproof laquer. He makes leather pictures aswell. One of these _ a hunting scene _ took {2 months}to make. An intricately carved saddle is also displayed. It is worth{Â£1400}but is not for sale. The{weaver}spins the wool himself, dyes it using only natural dyes (eg. stinging nettle, tea, rhubarb leaves etc.) and then weaves it on his loom.The fabric is then made up into clothes which he sells. The Craft Centre advertises in the { {Clevedon Mercury}and is also in the { {A.A. handbook.}On bank holiday weekends they have up to{2000}visitors _ so boosting tourism in{Clevedon.
